A day for the designers and developers building the future of the web.

On Wednesday 9th April, back-to-back with JSConf AU, the historic Melbourne Arts House will be filled with international and local experts, great food and coffee, and much food for thought.

Melbourne Arts House, 1874

It’ll be a small and special day, following on from the fantastic CSSConf US and CSSConf EU. There’ll also be some fun side-events, allowing you to see parts of Melbourne and hang out with some new friends.

Tickets go on sale early 2014 and will be strictly limited.

Ticket availability will be announced via our mailing list and on the @cssconfau Twitter account. Sign up below to ensure you don’t miss out:

A number of student and sponsorship tickets will be available to those who need them.

Team

The core organising group is @benschwarz, @mobywhale, @xzyfer, @glenmaddern and @toolmantim. We’ve run community events all around Australia including JSConf, RubyConf, SydCSS and Rails Camp.

Sponsorship

We’re looking for fantastic companies to help make this event possible. If you think your company could help, please drop an email to sponsponsors@somewhere.com

...

Spread the word

If you know someone that you’d like to be at the first CSSConf Australia, either to speak or just to hang out with, then let them know. If you don’t know anyone in particular, ask your Twitter peeps! Let’s try to get as many great people together as we can.

Code of Conduct

CSSConf Australia strives to be an inclusive, safe, accessible and fun event for everyone involved. It’s an important condition of participation that all organisers, sponsors and attendees follow the Conference Code of Conduct at the conference and during in related events.

Get in touch

You can find us on Twitter at @cssconfau, and by email at somewhere@somwhere.com.
